abstract: Scientists find few bird species on Yanaba Island, Papua New Guinea, where villagers live on sandy beaches.
snippet: Scientists find few bird species on Yanaba Island, Papua New Guinea, where villagers live on sandy beaches.
lead_paragraph: Jack Dumbacher, curator of ornithology and mammalogy at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea, where he is studying island birds and their diseases.

headline.main: Wind, Sand and Starlings at Yanaba Island
